question: Which of the following was equal to the atomic weight of the middle element in the Dobereiner's Triads?
option1: arithmetic mean of the atomic weights of the other two elements
option2: geometric mean of the atomic weights of the other two elements
option3: difference between the atomic weights of the other two elements
option4: sum of the atomic weights of the other two elements
answer: arithmetic mean of the atomic weights of the other two elements
explanation: Dobereiner was the first scientist to classify the elements in some groups. In the triads of elements the atomic weight of the middle element was the arithmetic mean of the atomic weights of the other two.
